name: The Obsidian Gate
roomDescription: A massive portal frame of obsidian pulses with chaotic violet energy in the center of this scorched chamber. The air smells of ozone and brimstone. A six-armed serpent woman stands guard, her blades weaving a hypnotic pattern, while hulking toad-like demons crouch near the lava pits that dot the floor.
dmDescription: The Marilith commands the Hezrous, using her Reactive trait to punish movement.
Lava pits deal 10d10 fire damage ({{sm-0}} to avoid falling in if pushed).
The portal surges every round (initiative 20), forcing a {{sm-1}} or the creature is restrained by gravity waves.
Destroying the control crystals (AC 18, 50 HP) closes the portal and banishes the Hezrous.
Treasure: The Marilith wears a belt of fire giant strength (rare).

name: Iron Sentinel
roomDescription: Gears grind and steam hisses in this industrial forge. Standing motionless before the blast furnace is a massive iron statue, its eyes glowing with heat. Floating suits of animated armor patrol the catwalks above, and scuttling creatures with feathery antennae chitter near piles of scrap metal.
dmDescription: The Iron Golem heals from fire damage; the Helmed Horrors will actively cast/trigger fire traps to heal it.
Rust Monsters threaten the party's equipment ({{sm-0}} to identify the threat).
Catwalks are 30ft high; falling deals 3d6 bludgeoning damage.
Ventilation pipes spew steam randomly ({{sm-1}}).
Hidden control panel ({{sm-2}} to operate) can vent steam onto the Golem (slowing it).

name: Vampire Court
roomDescription: Velvet drapes cover the windows of this opulent ballroom. A pale figure in fine silk swirls a goblet of crimson liquid, flanked by two towering statues of grotesque gargoyles. 'More guests?' he sighs. 'The golems were just getting hungry.'
dmDescription: The Vampire uses his Spider Climb to stay on the ceiling, casting spells or charming targets.
The Stone Golems block the exit and grapple spellcasters.
The Vampire's Charm requires a {{sm-0}}.
If reduced to 0 HP, the Vampire turns to mist and flees to its coffin (hidden in a crypt, {{sm-1}}).
Treasure: The goblet is gold (500 gp) and filled with Potion of Vitality.

name: Green Dragon's Lair
roomDescription: Thick fog obscures the floor of this cavern, smelling faintly of chlorine. Twisted roots hang from the ceiling. A massive serpentine dragon with emerald scales lies coiled atop a mound of coins, surrounded by heavily armed humanoid guards who look glazed-eyed and loyal.
dmDescription: The dragon uses its Poison Breath immediately (DC 19 Con save).
The Gladiators are thralls and fight to the death.
Lair actions: The fog is poisonous ({{sm-0}} or poisoned condition).
Wall of Thorns can entrap players ({{sm-1}}).
The dragon will try to drag a grapple target into the deep water pool.

name: Beholder's Sanctum
roomDescription: This central chamber is a vertical shaft, hundreds of feet deep. Walkways cross the void, but wait—some of the stalactites are moving. A central sphere covered in eyes floats upward, screaming about intruders stealing its secrets.
dmDescription: The Beholder uses its Antimagic Cone to suppress flight and magic items.
Ropers look like stalagmites ({{sm-0}} to discern) and grapple targets to pull them off walkways.
Falling deals 10d6 damage before hitting a lower web/ledge.
The Beholder knows the layout perfectly and uses cover.
Treasure floats in an anti-gravity field at the top.

name: Mind Flayer Colony
roomDescription: The air hums with psychic resonance. Violet slime coats the organic-looking walls of this incubation chamber. Four tall figures with squid-like heads supervise a brine pool, while brain-like creatures on legs scuttle around their feet.
dmDescription: Mind Flayers attempt to stun the party with Mind Blast (DC 15 Int save) immediately.
The Arcanist has Lightning Bolt and Wall of Force.
Intellect Devourers target stunned players to use Body Thief ({{sm-0}} contest).
The brine pool is acidic ({{sm-1}}).
Psionic static imposes disadvantage on concentration checks.
aiRoomPrompt: Top-down bird's eye view battle map for tabletop RPG with 5ft square grid overlay. 100ft x 100ft alien incubation chamber. Organic walls. Brine pools with violet liquid. Brain jars. Strange tubes/machinery. Dim pink lighting. Clean lines.

name: Necropolis Guard
roomDescription: The golden sarcophagus bursts open, and a shriveled figure wrapped in funereal linens rises, eyes burning with unholy light. Around the room, eight smaller sarcophagi slide open in unison. The dust of ages fills the air, carrying the scent of myrrh and rot.
dmDescription: Mummy Lord uses Blasphemous Word to stun non-undead.
Mummy Rot prevents healing ({{sm-0}} to remove curse).
Lair action: Whirlwind of Sand causes blindness.
The Canopic Jars (Heart) are hidden in the room ({{sm-1}} to find); destroying the heart prevents rejuvenation.
Fire is effective but the Lord has fire resistance spells pre-cast.

name: Elemental Chaos
roomDescription: This chamber is a clash of opposing forces. One half is an inferno of magma, the other a freezing pool of seawater. Standing on the border are four armored figures made of pure elemental energy—two burning, two flowing.
dmDescription: The Myrmidons are intelligent tactics users.
Fire Myrmidons stay near magma (heals them? No, but hazardous to players).
Steam explosion occurs where fire and water meet ({{sm-0}}).
Magma deals {{sm-1}} fire damage on contact.
Water is difficult terrain and freezing ({{sm-2}} cold damage).

name: Hydra Swamp
roomDescription: The floor of this massive cavern is a knee-deep bog. Massive cypress trees grow from the muck. The water ripples, and suddenly, dozens of serpentine heads rise from the gloom. Three massive bodies follow.
dmDescription: Three Hydras attack from different angles.
Deep bog areas are difficult terrain and require swimming.
Heads regrow if not cauterized by fire.
A {{sm-0}} allows players to spot submerged hydras before they strike.
Hidden underwater chest requires {{sm-1}} to open without alerting more beasts.

name: Drow High Council
roomDescription: A spider-silk bridge spans the darkness, leading to a floating platform dominated by a statue of the Spider Queen. A council of dark elves stands in judgment. 'Surface dwellers,' one priestess sneers. 'A worthy sacrifice.'
dmDescription: Priestesses summon Demon Allies (Yochlol) if not silenced ({{sm-0}} to recognize the casting).
Mages fly using Levitate/Fly and cast Cloudkill.
Elite Warriors engage in melee with poisoned weapons ({{sm-1}} or poisoned).
The bridge can be cut (AC 10, 10 HP), dropping creatures into the abyss (fatal).
Darkness spells are used liberally.
